<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>
<s> economic policies pursued since 2003 by king mohammed vi have brought macroeconomic stability to the country with generally low inflation improved financial performance and steady progress in developing the service and industrial sectors <\s>
<s> in 2006 morocco entered a free trade agreement fta with the us and in 2008 entered into an advanced status in its 2000 association agreement with the eu <\s>
<s> however poverty illiteracy and unemployment rates remain high <\s>
<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>
<s> morocco's trade and budget deficits widened in 2010 and reducing govenment spending and adapting to sluggish economic growth in europe will be challenges in 2011 <\s>
<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>
<s> mozambique at independence in 1975 mozambique was one of the world's poorest countries <\s>
<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>
<s> in 1987 the government embarked on a series of macroeconomic reforms designed to stabilize the economy <\s>
<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>
<s> fiscal reforms including the introduction of a value-added tax and reform of the customs service have improved the government's revenue collection abilities <\s>
<s> in spite of these gains mozambique remains dependent upon foreign assistance for more than half of its annual budget and the majority of the population remains below the poverty line <\s>
<s> subsistence agriculture continues to employ the vast majority of the country's work force and smallholder agricultural productivity and productivity growth is weak <\s>
<s> a substantial trade imbalance persists although the opening of the mozal aluminum smelter the country's largest foreign investment project to date has increased export earnings <\s>
<s> at the end of 2007 and after years of negotiations the government took over portugal's majority share of the cahora bassa hydroelectricity hcb company a dam that was not transferred to mozambique at independence because of the ensuing civil war and unpaid debts <\s>
<s> more power is needed for additional investment projects in titanium extraction and processing and garment manufacturing that could further close the import export gap <\s>
<s> mozambique's once substantial foreign debt has been reduced through forgiveness and rescheduling under the imf's heavily indebted poor countries hipc and enhanced hipc initiatives and is now at a manageable level <\s>
<s> in july 2007 the millennium challenge corporation mcc signed a compact with mozambique the compact entered into force in september 2008 and will continue for five years <\s>
<s> compact projects will focus on improving sanitation roads agriculture and the business regulation environment in an effort to spur economic growth in the four northern provinces of the country <\s>
<s> mozambique grew at an average annual rate of 9 in the decade up to 2007 one of africa's strongest performances <\s>
<s> however heavy reliance on aluminum which accounts for about one-third of exports subjects the economy to volatile international prices <\s>
<s> the sharp decline in aluminum prices during the global economic crisis lowered gdp growth by several percentage points <\s>
<s> despite 8.3 gdp growth in 2010 the increasing cost of living prompted citizens to riot in september 2010 after bread price increases were announced <\s>
<s> in an attempt to contain the cost of living the government implemented subsidies decreased taxes and tariffs and instituted other fiscal measures <\s>
<s> namibia the economy is heavily dependent on the extraction and processing of minerals for export <\s>
<s> mining accounts for 8 of gdp but provides more than 50 of foreign exchange earnings <\s>
<s> rich alluvial diamond deposits make namibia a primary source for gem-quality diamonds <\s>
<s> namibia is the fourth-largest exporter of nonfuel minerals in africa the world's fifth-largest producer of uranium and the producer of large quantities of lead zinc tin silver and tungsten <\s>
<s> the mining sector employs only about 3 of the population while about 35-40 of the population depends on subsistence agriculture for its livelihood <\s>
<s> namibia normally imports about 50 of its cereal requirements in drought years food shortages are a major problem in rural areas <\s>
<s> a high per capita gdp relative to the region hides one of the world's most unequal income distributions as shown by namibia's gini coefficient <\s>
<s> the namibian economy is closely linked to south africa with the namibian dollar pegged one-to-one to the south african rand <\s>
<s> until 2010 namibia drew 40 of its budget revenues from the southern african customs union sacu <\s>
<s> increased payments from sacu put namibia's budget into surplus in 2007 for the first time since independence <\s>
<s> sacu allotments to namibia increased in 2009 but will drop for 2010 and 2011 because south africa went into recession during the global economic crisis reducing overall sacu income <\s>
<s> increased fish production and mining of zinc copper uranium and silver spurred growth in 2003-08 but growth in recent years was undercut by poor fish catches higher costs of producing metals and the global recession <\s>
<s> nauru revenues of this tiny island have traditionally come from exports of phosphates now significantly depleted <\s>
<s> an australian company in 2005 entered into an agreement intended to exploit remaining supplies <\s>
<s> few other resources exist with most necessities being imported mainly from australia its former occupier and later major source of support <\s>
<s> the rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems <\s>
<s> reserves of phosphates may only last until 2010 at current mining rates <\s>
<s> in anticipation of the exhaustion of nauru's phosphate deposits substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for nauru's economic future <\s>
<s> as a result of heavy spending from the trust funds the government faces virtual bankruptcy <\s>
<s> to cut costs the government has frozen wages and reduced overstaffed public service departments <\s>
<s> nauru lost further revenue in 2008 with the closure of australia's refugee processing center making it almost totally dependent on food imports and foreign aid <\s>
<s> housing hospitals and other capital plant is deteriorating <\s>
<s> the cost to australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb <\s>
<s> few comprehensive statistics on the nauru economy exist with estimates of nauru's gdp varying widely <\s>
<s> navassa island subsistence fishing and commercial trawling occur within refuge waters <\s>
<s> nepal nepal is among the poorest and least developed countries in the world with almost one-quarter of its population living below the poverty line <\s>
<s> agriculture is the mainstay of the economy providing a livelihood for three-fourths of the population and accounting for about one-third of gdp <\s>
<s> industrial activity mainly involves the processing of agricultural products including pulses jute sugarcane tobacco and grain <\s>
<s> nepal has considerable scope for exploiting its potential in hydropower with an estimated 42,000 mw of feasible capacity but political instability hampers foreign investment <\s>
<s> additional challenges to nepal's growth include its landlocked geographic location civil strife and labor unrest and its susceptibility to natural disaster <\s>
<s> netherlands the netherlands economy is noted for stable industrial relations moderate unemployment and inflation a sizable current account surplus and an important role as a european transportation hub <\s>
<s> industrial activity is predominantly in food processing chemicals petroleum refining and electrical machinery <\s>
<s> a highly mechanized agricultural sector employs only 2 of the labor force but provides large surpluses for the food-processing industry and for exports <\s>
<s> the netherlands along with 11 of its eu partners began circulating the euro currency on 1 january 2002 <\s>
<s> the country has been one of the leading european nations for attracting foreign direct investment and is one of the four largest investors in the us <\s>
<s> after 26 years of uninterrupted economic growth the netherlands economy which is highly open and dependent on foreign trade and financial services was hard-hit by global economic crisis <\s>
<s> dutch gdp contracted 3.9 in 2009 while exports declined nearly 25 due to a sharp contraction in world demand <\s>
<s> the dutch financial sector has also suffered due in part to the high exposure of some dutch banks to u s <\s>
<s> the state retains monopolies in a number of sectors including tobacco the telephone network and the postal service <\s>
<s> living standards are high roughly comparable to those in prosperous french metropolitan areas <\s>
<s> mongolia economic activity in mongolia has traditionally been based on herding and agriculture mongolia's extensive mineral deposits however have attracted foreign investors <\s>
<s> the country holds copper gold coal molybdenum fluorspar uranium tin and tungsten deposits which account for a large part of foreign direct investment and government revenues <\s>
<s> soviet assistance at its height one-third of gdp disappeared almost overnight in 1990 and 1991 at the time of the dismantlement of the ussr <\s>
<s> the following decade saw mongolia endure both deep recession because of political inaction and natural disasters as well as economic growth because of reform-embracing free-market economics and extensive privatization of the formerly state-run economy <\s>
<s> severe winters and summer droughts in 2000-02 resulted in massive livestock die-off and zero or negative gdp growth <\s>
<s> this was compounded by falling prices for mongolia's primary sector exports and widespread opposition to privatization <\s>
<s> growth averaged nearly 9 per year in 2004-08 largely because of high copper prices and new gold production <\s>
<s> in 2008 mongolia experienced a soaring inflation rate with year-to-year inflation reaching nearly 30 the highest inflation rate in over a decade <\s>
<s> by late 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of the global financial crisis falling commodity prices helped lower inflation but also reduced government revenues and forced cuts in spending <\s>
<s> in early 2009 the international monetary fund reached a 236 million stand-by arrangement with mongolia and the country has started to move out of the crisis <\s>
<s> although the banking sector remains unstable the government is now enforcing stricter supervision regulations <\s>
<s> in october 2009 the government passed long-awaited legislation on an investment agreement to develop mongolia's oyu tolgoi mine considered to be one of the world's largest untapped copper deposits <\s>
<s> the economy grew an estimated 7 in 2010 largely on the strength of exports to nearby countries and international reserves reached 1.6 billion in september an all time high for mongolia <\s>
<s> mongolia's economy continues to be heavily influenced by its neighbors <\s>
<s> mongolia purchases 95 of its petroleum products and a substantial amount of electric power from russia leaving it vulnerable to price increases <\s>
<s> trade with china represents more than half of mongolia's total external trade china receives about two-thirds of mongolia's exports <\s>
<s> remittances from mongolians working abroad are sizable but have fallen due to the economic crisis money laundering is a growing concern <\s>
<s> mongolia joined the world trade organization in 1997 and seeks to expand its participation in regional economic and trade regimes <\s>
<s> montenegro montenegro severed its economy from federal control and from serbia during the milosevic era and maintained its own central bank adopted the deutchmark then the euro rather than the yugoslav dinar as official currency collected customs tariffs and managed its own budget <\s>
<s> the dissolution of the loose political union between serbia and montenegro in 2006 led to separate membership in several international financial institutions such as the european bank for reconstruction and development <\s>
<s> in january 2007 montenegro joined the world bank and imf <\s>
<s> montenegro is pursuing its own membership in the world trade organization and signed a stabilization and association agreement with the european union in october 2007 <\s>
<s> the european council granted candidate country status to montenegro at the december 2010 session <\s>
<s> unemployment and regional disparities in development are key political and economic problems <\s>
<s> montenegro has privatized its large aluminum complex the dominant industry as well as most of its financial sector and has begun to attract foreign direct investment in the tourism sector <\s>
<s> the global financial crisis has had a significant negative impact on the economy due to the ongoing credit crunch a decline in the real estate sector and a fall in aluminum exports <\s>
<s> montserrat severe volcanic activity which began in july 1995 has put a damper on this small open economy <\s>
<s> a catastrophic eruption in june 1997 closed the airports and seaports causing further economic and social dislocation <\s>
<s> two-thirds of the 12,000 inhabitants fled the island <\s>
<s> some began to return in 1998 but lack of housing limited the number <\s>
<s> the agriculture sector continued to be affected by the lack of suitable land for farming and the destruction of crops <\s>
<s> prospects for the economy depend largely on developments in relation to the volcanic activity and on public sector construction activity <\s>
<s> the uk has launched a three-year 122.8 million aid program to help reconstruct the economy <\s>
<s> half of the island is expected to remain uninhabitable for another decade <\s>
<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>

<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>

<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>

<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>

<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>

<s> namibia normally imports about 50 of its cereal requirements in drought years food shortages are a major problem in rural areas <\s>
<s> a high per capita gdp relative to the region hides one of the world's most unequal income distributions as shown by namibia's gini coefficient <\s>
<s> the namibian economy is closely linked to south africa with the namibian dollar pegged one-to-one to the south african rand <\s>
<s> until 2010 namibia drew 40 of its budget revenues from the southern african customs union sacu <\s>
<s> increased payments from sacu put namibia's budget into surplus in 2007 for the first time since independence <\s>
<s> sacu allotments to namibia increased in 2009 but will drop for 2010 and 2011 because south africa went into recession during the global economic crisis reducing overall sacu income <\s>
<s> increased fish production and mining of zinc copper uranium and silver spurred growth in 2003-08 but growth in recent years was undercut by poor fish catches higher costs of producing metals and the global recession <\s>
<s> nauru revenues of this tiny island have traditionally come from exports of phosphates now significantly depleted <\s>
<s> an australian company in 2005 entered into an agreement intended to exploit remaining supplies <\s>
<s> few other resources exist with most necessities being imported mainly from australia its former occupier and later major source of support <\s>
<s> the rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems <\s>
<s> reserves of phosphates may only last until 2010 at current mining rates <\s>
<s> in anticipation of the exhaustion of nauru's phosphate deposits substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for nauru's economic future <\s>
<s> as a result of heavy spending from the trust funds the government faces virtual bankruptcy <\s>
<s> to cut costs the government has frozen wages and reduced overstaffed public service departments <\s>
<s> nauru lost further revenue in 2008 with the closure of australia's refugee processing center making it almost totally dependent on food imports and foreign aid <\s>
<s> housing hospitals and other capital plant is deteriorating <\s>
<s> the cost to australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb <\s>
<s> few comprehensive statistics on the nauru economy exist with estimates of nauru's gdp varying widely <\s>
<s> navassa island subsistence fishing and commercial trawling occur within refuge waters <\s>
<s> nepal nepal is among the poorest and least developed countries in the world with almost one-quarter of its population living below the poverty line <\s>
<s> agriculture is the mainstay of the economy providing a livelihood for three-fourths of the population and accounting for about one-third of gdp <\s>
<s> industrial activity mainly involves the processing of agricultural products including pulses jute sugarcane tobacco and grain <\s>
<s> nepal has considerable scope for exploiting its potential in hydropower with an estimated 42,000 mw of feasible capacity but political instability hampers foreign investment <\s>
<s> additional challenges to nepal's growth include its landlocked geographic location civil strife and labor unrest and its susceptibility to natural disaster <\s>
<s> netherlands the netherlands economy is noted for stable industrial relations moderate unemployment and inflation a sizable current account surplus and an important role as a european transportation hub <\s>
<s> industrial activity is predominantly in food processing chemicals petroleum refining and electrical machinery <\s>
<s> a highly mechanized agricultural sector employs only 2 of the labor force but provides large surpluses for the food-processing industry and for exports <\s>
<s> the netherlands along with 11 of its eu partners began circulating the euro currency on 1 january 2002 <\s>
<s> the country has been one of the leading european nations for attracting foreign direct investment and is one of the four largest investors in the us <\s>
<s> after 26 years of uninterrupted economic growth the netherlands economy which is highly open and dependent on foreign trade and financial services was hard-hit by global economic crisis <\s>
<s> dutch gdp contracted 3.9 in 2009 while exports declined nearly 25 due to a sharp contraction in world demand <\s>
<s> the dutch financial sector has also suffered due in part to the high exposure of some dutch banks to u s <\s>
<s> the state retains monopolies in a number of sectors including tobacco the telephone network and the postal service <\s>
<s> living standards are high roughly comparable to those in prosperous french metropolitan areas <\s>
<s> mongolia economic activity in mongolia has traditionally been based on herding and agriculture mongolia's extensive mineral deposits however have attracted foreign investors <\s>
<s> the country holds copper gold coal molybdenum fluorspar uranium tin and tungsten deposits which account for a large part of foreign direct investment and government revenues <\s>
<s> soviet assistance at its height one-third of gdp disappeared almost overnight in 1990 and 1991 at the time of the dismantlement of the ussr <\s>
<s> the following decade saw mongolia endure both deep recession because of political inaction and natural disasters as well as economic growth because of reform-embracing free-market economics and extensive privatization of the formerly state-run economy <\s>
<s> severe winters and summer droughts in 2000-02 resulted in massive livestock die-off and zero or negative gdp growth <\s>
<s> this was compounded by falling prices for mongolia's primary sector exports and widespread opposition to privatization <\s>
<s> growth averaged nearly 9 per year in 2004-08 largely because of high copper prices and new gold production <\s>
<s> in 2008 mongolia experienced a soaring inflation rate with year-to-year inflation reaching nearly 30 the highest inflation rate in over a decade <\s>
<s> by late 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of the global financial crisis falling commodity prices helped lower inflation but also reduced government revenues and forced cuts in spending <\s>
<s> in early 2009 the international monetary fund reached a 236 million stand-by arrangement with mongolia and the country has started to move out of the crisis <\s>
<s> although the banking sector remains unstable the government is now enforcing stricter supervision regulations <\s>
<s> in october 2009 the government passed long-awaited legislation on an investment agreement to develop mongolia's oyu tolgoi mine considered to be one of the world's largest untapped copper deposits <\s>
<s> the economy grew an estimated 7 in 2010 largely on the strength of exports to nearby countries and international reserves reached 1.6 billion in september an all time high for mongolia <\s>
<s> mongolia's economy continues to be heavily influenced by its neighbors <\s>
<s> mongolia purchases 95 of its petroleum products and a substantial amount of electric power from russia leaving it vulnerable to price increases <\s>
<s> trade with china represents more than half of mongolia's total external trade china receives about two-thirds of mongolia's exports <\s>
<s> remittances from mongolians working abroad are sizable but have fallen due to the economic crisis money laundering is a growing concern <\s>
<s> mongolia joined the world trade organization in 1997 and seeks to expand its participation in regional economic and trade regimes <\s>
<s> montenegro montenegro severed its economy from federal control and from serbia during the milosevic era and maintained its own central bank adopted the deutchmark then the euro rather than the yugoslav dinar as official currency collected customs tariffs and managed its own budget <\s>
<s> the dissolution of the loose political union between serbia and montenegro in 2006 led to separate membership in several international financial institutions such as the european bank for reconstruction and development <\s>
<s> in january 2007 montenegro joined the world bank and imf <\s>
<s> montenegro is pursuing its own membership in the world trade organization and signed a stabilization and association agreement with the european union in october 2007 <\s>
<s> the european council granted candidate country status to montenegro at the december 2010 session <\s>
<s> unemployment and regional disparities in development are key political and economic problems <\s>
<s> montenegro has privatized its large aluminum complex the dominant industry as well as most of its financial sector and has begun to attract foreign direct investment in the tourism sector <\s>
<s> the global financial crisis has had a significant negative impact on the economy due to the ongoing credit crunch a decline in the real estate sector and a fall in aluminum exports <\s>
<s> montserrat severe volcanic activity which began in july 1995 has put a damper on this small open economy <\s>
<s> a catastrophic eruption in june 1997 closed the airports and seaports causing further economic and social dislocation <\s>
<s> two-thirds of the 12,000 inhabitants fled the island <\s>
<s> some began to return in 1998 but lack of housing limited the number <\s>
<s> the agriculture sector continued to be affected by the lack of suitable land for farming and the destruction of crops <\s>
<s> prospects for the economy depend largely on developments in relation to the volcanic activity and on public sector construction activity <\s>
<s> the uk has launched a three-year 122.8 million aid program to help reconstruct the economy <\s>
<s> half of the island is expected to remain uninhabitable for another decade <\s>
<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>
<s> economic policies pursued since 2003 by king mohammed vi have brought macroeconomic stability to the country with generally low inflation improved financial performance and steady progress in developing the service and industrial sectors <\s>
<s> in 2006 morocco entered a free trade agreement fta with the us and in 2008 entered into an advanced status in its 2000 association agreement with the eu <\s>
<s> however poverty illiteracy and unemployment rates remain high <\s>
<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>
<s> morocco's trade and budget deficits widened in 2010 and reducing govenment spending and adapting to sluggish economic growth in europe will be challenges in 2011 <\s>
<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>
<s> mozambique at independence in 1975 mozambique was one of the world's poorest countries <\s>
<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>
<s> in 1987 the government embarked on a series of macroeconomic reforms designed to stabilize the economy <\s>
<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>
<s> fiscal reforms including the introduction of a value-added tax and reform of the customs service have improved the government's revenue collection abilities <\s>
<s> in spite of these gains mozambique remains dependent upon foreign assistance for more than half of its annual budget and the majority of the population remains below the poverty line <\s>
<s> subsistence agriculture continues to employ the vast majority of the country's work force and smallholder agricultural productivity and productivity growth is weak <\s>
<s> a substantial trade imbalance persists although the opening of the mozal aluminum smelter the country's largest foreign investment project to date has increased export earnings <\s>
<s> at the end of 2007 and after years of negotiations the government took over portugal's majority share of the cahora bassa hydroelectricity hcb company a dam that was not transferred to mozambique at independence because of the ensuing civil war and unpaid debts <\s>
<s> more power is needed for additional investment projects in titanium extraction and processing and garment manufacturing that could further close the import export gap <\s>
<s> mozambique's once substantial foreign debt has been reduced through forgiveness and rescheduling under the imf's heavily indebted poor countries hipc and enhanced hipc initiatives and is now at a manageable level <\s>
<s> in july 2007 the millennium challenge corporation mcc signed a compact with mozambique the compact entered into force in september 2008 and will continue for five years <\s>
<s> compact projects will focus on improving sanitation roads agriculture and the business regulation environment in an effort to spur economic growth in the four northern provinces of the country <\s>
<s> mozambique grew at an average annual rate of 9 in the decade up to 2007 one of africa's strongest performances <\s>
<s> however heavy reliance on aluminum which accounts for about one-third of exports subjects the economy to volatile international prices <\s>
<s> the sharp decline in aluminum prices during the global economic crisis lowered gdp growth by several percentage points <\s>
<s> despite 8.3 gdp growth in 2010 the increasing cost of living prompted citizens to riot in september 2010 after bread price increases were announced <\s>
<s> in an attempt to contain the cost of living the government implemented subsidies decreased taxes and tariffs and instituted other fiscal measures <\s>
<s> namibia the economy is heavily dependent on the extraction and processing of minerals for export <\s>
<s> mining accounts for 8 of gdp but provides more than 50 of foreign exchange earnings <\s>
<s> rich alluvial diamond deposits make namibia a primary source for gem-quality diamonds <\s>
<s> namibia is the fourth-largest exporter of nonfuel minerals in africa the world's fifth-largest producer of uranium and the producer of large quantities of lead zinc tin silver and tungsten <\s>
<s> the mining sector employs only about 3 of the population while about 35-40 of the population depends on subsistence agriculture for its livelihood <\s>
<s> namibia normally imports about 50 of its cereal requirements in drought years food shortages are a major problem in rural areas <\s>
<s> a high per capita gdp relative to the region hides one of the world's most unequal income distributions as shown by namibia's gini coefficient <\s>
<s> the namibian economy is closely linked to south africa with the namibian dollar pegged one-to-one to the south african rand <\s>
<s> until 2010 namibia drew 40 of its budget revenues from the southern african customs union sacu <\s>
<s> increased payments from sacu put namibia's budget into surplus in 2007 for the first time since independence <\s>
<s> sacu allotments to namibia increased in 2009 but will drop for 2010 and 2011 because south africa went into recession during the global economic crisis reducing overall sacu income <\s>
<s> increased fish production and mining of zinc copper uranium and silver spurred growth in 2003-08 but growth in recent years was undercut by poor fish catches higher costs of producing metals and the global recession <\s>
<s> nauru revenues of this tiny island have traditionally come from exports of phosphates now significantly depleted <\s>
<s> an australian company in 2005 entered into an agreement intended to exploit remaining supplies <\s>
<s> few other resources exist with most necessities being imported mainly from australia its former occupier and later major source of support <\s>
<s> the rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems <\s>
<s> reserves of phosphates may only last until 2010 at current mining rates <\s>
<s> in anticipation of the exhaustion of nauru's phosphate deposits substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for nauru's economic future <\s>
<s> as a result of heavy spending from the trust funds the government faces virtual bankruptcy <\s>
<s> to cut costs the government has frozen wages and reduced overstaffed public service departments <\s>
<s> nauru lost further revenue in 2008 with the closure of australia's refugee processing center making it almost totally dependent on food imports and foreign aid <\s>
<s> housing hospitals and other capital plant is deteriorating <\s>
<s> the cost to australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb <\s>
<s> few comprehensive statistics on the nauru economy exist with estimates of nauru's gdp varying widely <\s>
<s> navassa island subsistence fishing and commercial trawling occur within refuge waters <\s>

<s> the country holds copper gold coal molybdenum fluorspar uranium tin and tungsten deposits which account for a large part of foreign direct investment and government revenues <\s>
<s> soviet assistance at its height one-third of gdp disappeared almost overnight in 1990 and 1991 at the time of the dismantlement of the ussr <\s>
<s> the following decade saw mongolia endure both deep recession because of political inaction and natural disasters as well as economic growth because of reform-embracing free-market economics and extensive privatization of the formerly state-run economy <\s>
<s> severe winters and summer droughts in 2000-02 resulted in massive livestock die-off and zero or negative gdp growth <\s>
<s> this was compounded by falling prices for mongolia's primary sector exports and widespread opposition to privatization <\s>
<s> growth averaged nearly 9 per year in 2004-08 largely because of high copper prices and new gold production <\s>
<s> in 2008 mongolia experienced a soaring inflation rate with year-to-year inflation reaching nearly 30 the highest inflation rate in over a decade <\s>
<s> by late 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of the global financial crisis falling commodity prices helped lower inflation but also reduced government revenues and forced cuts in spending <\s>
<s> in early 2009 the international monetary fund reached a 236 million stand-by arrangement with mongolia and the country has started to move out of the crisis <\s>
<s> although the banking sector remains unstable the government is now enforcing stricter supervision regulations <\s>
<s> in october 2009 the government passed long-awaited legislation on an investment agreement to develop mongolia's oyu tolgoi mine considered to be one of the world's largest untapped copper deposits <\s>
<s> the economy grew an estimated 7 in 2010 largely on the strength of exports to nearby countries and international reserves reached 1.6 billion in september an all time high for mongolia <\s>
<s> mongolia's economy continues to be heavily influenced by its neighbors <\s>
<s> mongolia purchases 95 of its petroleum products and a substantial amount of electric power from russia leaving it vulnerable to price increases <\s>
<s> trade with china represents more than half of mongolia's total external trade china receives about two-thirds of mongolia's exports <\s>
<s> remittances from mongolians working abroad are sizable but have fallen due to the economic crisis money laundering is a growing concern <\s>
<s> mongolia joined the world trade organization in 1997 and seeks to expand its participation in regional economic and trade regimes <\s>
<s> montenegro montenegro severed its economy from federal control and from serbia during the milosevic era and maintained its own central bank adopted the deutchmark then the euro rather than the yugoslav dinar as official currency collected customs tariffs and managed its own budget <\s>
<s> the dissolution of the loose political union between serbia and montenegro in 2006 led to separate membership in several international financial institutions such as the european bank for reconstruction and development <\s>
<s> in january 2007 montenegro joined the world bank and imf <\s>
<s> montenegro is pursuing its own membership in the world trade organization and signed a stabilization and association agreement with the european union in october 2007 <\s>
<s> the european council granted candidate country status to montenegro at the december 2010 session <\s>
<s> unemployment and regional disparities in development are key political and economic problems <\s>
<s> montenegro has privatized its large aluminum complex the dominant industry as well as most of its financial sector and has begun to attract foreign direct investment in the tourism sector <\s>
<s> the global financial crisis has had a significant negative impact on the economy due to the ongoing credit crunch a decline in the real estate sector and a fall in aluminum exports <\s>
<s> montserrat severe volcanic activity which began in july 1995 has put a damper on this small open economy <\s>
<s> a catastrophic eruption in june 1997 closed the airports and seaports causing further economic and social dislocation <\s>
<s> two-thirds of the 12,000 inhabitants fled the island <\s>
<s> some began to return in 1998 but lack of housing limited the number <\s>
<s> the agriculture sector continued to be affected by the lack of suitable land for farming and the destruction of crops <\s>
<s> prospects for the economy depend largely on developments in relation to the volcanic activity and on public sector construction activity <\s>
<s> the uk has launched a three-year 122.8 million aid program to help reconstruct the economy <\s>
<s> half of the island is expected to remain uninhabitable for another decade <\s>
<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>
<s> economic policies pursued since 2003 by king mohammed vi have brought macroeconomic stability to the country with generally low inflation improved financial performance and steady progress in developing the service and industrial sectors <\s>
<s> in 2006 morocco entered a free trade agreement fta with the us and in 2008 entered into an advanced status in its 2000 association agreement with the eu <\s>
<s> however poverty illiteracy and unemployment rates remain high <\s>
<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>
<s> morocco's trade and budget deficits widened in 2010 and reducing govenment spending and adapting to sluggish economic growth in europe will be challenges in 2011 <\s>
<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>
<s> mozambique at independence in 1975 mozambique was one of the world's poorest countries <\s>
<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>
<s> in 1987 the government embarked on a series of macroeconomic reforms designed to stabilize the economy <\s>
<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>
<s> fiscal reforms including the introduction of a value-added tax and reform of the customs service have improved the government's revenue collection abilities <\s>
<s> in spite of these gains mozambique remains dependent upon foreign assistance for more than half of its annual budget and the majority of the population remains below the poverty line <\s>
<s> subsistence agriculture continues to employ the vast majority of the country's work force and smallholder agricultural productivity and productivity growth is weak <\s>
<s> a substantial trade imbalance persists although the opening of the mozal aluminum smelter the country's largest foreign investment project to date has increased export earnings <\s>
<s> at the end of 2007 and after years of negotiations the government took over portugal's majority share of the cahora bassa hydroelectricity hcb company a dam that was not transferred to mozambique at independence because of the ensuing civil war and unpaid debts <\s>
<s> more power is needed for additional investment projects in titanium extraction and processing and garment manufacturing that could further close the import export gap <\s>
<s> mozambique's once substantial foreign debt has been reduced through forgiveness and rescheduling under the imf's heavily indebted poor countries hipc and enhanced hipc initiatives and is now at a manageable level <\s>
<s> in july 2007 the millennium challenge corporation mcc signed a compact with mozambique the compact entered into force in september 2008 and will continue for five years <\s>
<s> compact projects will focus on improving sanitation roads agriculture and the business regulation environment in an effort to spur economic growth in the four northern provinces of the country <\s>
<s> mozambique grew at an average annual rate of 9 in the decade up to 2007 one of africa's strongest performances <\s>
<s> however heavy reliance on aluminum which accounts for about one-third of exports subjects the economy to volatile international prices <\s>
<s> the sharp decline in aluminum prices during the global economic crisis lowered gdp growth by several percentage points <\s>
<s> despite 8.3 gdp growth in 2010 the increasing cost of living prompted citizens to riot in september 2010 after bread price increases were announced <\s>
<s> in an attempt to contain the cost of living the government implemented subsidies decreased taxes and tariffs and instituted other fiscal measures <\s>
<s> namibia the economy is heavily dependent on the extraction and processing of minerals for export <\s>
<s> mining accounts for 8 of gdp but provides more than 50 of foreign exchange earnings <\s>
<s> rich alluvial diamond deposits make namibia a primary source for gem-quality diamonds <\s>
<s> namibia is the fourth-largest exporter of nonfuel minerals in africa the world's fifth-largest producer of uranium and the producer of large quantities of lead zinc tin silver and tungsten <\s>
<s> the mining sector employs only about 3 of the population while about 35-40 of the population depends on subsistence agriculture for its livelihood <\s>
<s> namibia normally imports about 50 of its cereal requirements in drought years food shortages are a major problem in rural areas <\s>
<s> a high per capita gdp relative to the region hides one of the world's most unequal income distributions as shown by namibia's gini coefficient <\s>
<s> the namibian economy is closely linked to south africa with the namibian dollar pegged one-to-one to the south african rand <\s>
<s> until 2010 namibia drew 40 of its budget revenues from the southern african customs union sacu <\s>
<s> increased payments from sacu put namibia's budget into surplus in 2007 for the first time since independence <\s>
<s> sacu allotments to namibia increased in 2009 but will drop for 2010 and 2011 because south africa went into recession during the global economic crisis reducing overall sacu income <\s>
<s> increased fish production and mining of zinc copper uranium and silver spurred growth in 2003-08 but growth in recent years was undercut by poor fish catches higher costs of producing metals and the global recession <\s>
<s> nauru revenues of this tiny island have traditionally come from exports of phosphates now significantly depleted <\s>
<s> an australian company in 2005 entered into an agreement intended to exploit remaining supplies <\s>
<s> few other resources exist with most necessities being imported mainly from australia its former occupier and later major source of support <\s>
<s> the rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems <\s>
<s> reserves of phosphates may only last until 2010 at current mining rates <\s>
<s> in anticipation of the exhaustion of nauru's phosphate deposits substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for nauru's economic future <\s>
<s> as a result of heavy spending from the trust funds the government faces virtual bankruptcy <\s>
<s> to cut costs the government has frozen wages and reduced overstaffed public service departments <\s>
<s> nauru lost further revenue in 2008 with the closure of australia's refugee processing center making it almost totally dependent on food imports and foreign aid <\s>
<s> housing hospitals and other capital plant is deteriorating <\s>
<s> the cost to australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb <\s>
<s> few comprehensive statistics on the nauru economy exist with estimates of nauru's gdp varying widely <\s>
<s> navassa island subsistence fishing and commercial trawling occur within refuge waters <\s>
<s> nepal nepal is among the poorest and least developed countries in the world with almost one-quarter of its population living below the poverty line <\s>
<s> agriculture is the mainstay of the economy providing a livelihood for three-fourths of the population and accounting for about one-third of gdp <\s>
<s> industrial activity mainly involves the processing of agricultural products including pulses jute sugarcane tobacco and grain <\s>
<s> nepal has considerable scope for exploiting its potential in hydropower with an estimated 42,000 mw of feasible capacity but political instability hampers foreign investment <\s>
<s> additional challenges to nepal's growth include its landlocked geographic location civil strife and labor unrest and its susceptibility to natural disaster <\s>
<s> netherlands the netherlands economy is noted for stable industrial relations moderate unemployment and inflation a sizable current account surplus and an important role as a european transportation hub <\s>
<s> industrial activity is predominantly in food processing chemicals petroleum refining and electrical machinery <\s>
<s> a highly mechanized agricultural sector employs only 2 of the labor force but provides large surpluses for the food-processing industry and for exports <\s>
<s> the netherlands along with 11 of its eu partners began circulating the euro currency on 1 january 2002 <\s>
<s> the country has been one of the leading european nations for attracting foreign direct investment and is one of the four largest investors in the us <\s>
<s> after 26 years of uninterrupted economic growth the netherlands economy which is highly open and dependent on foreign trade and financial services was hard-hit by global economic crisis <\s>
<s> dutch gdp contracted 3.9 in 2009 while exports declined nearly 25 due to a sharp contraction in world demand <\s>
<s> the dutch financial sector has also suffered due in part to the high exposure of some dutch banks to u s <\s>
<s> the state retains monopolies in a number of sectors including tobacco the telephone network and the postal service <\s>
<s> living standards are high roughly comparable to those in prosperous french metropolitan areas <\s>
<s> mongolia economic activity in mongolia has traditionally been based on herding and agriculture mongolia's extensive mineral deposits however have attracted foreign investors <\s>
<s> the country holds copper gold coal molybdenum fluorspar uranium tin and tungsten deposits which account for a large part of foreign direct investment and government revenues <\s>
<s> soviet assistance at its height one-third of gdp disappeared almost overnight in 1990 and 1991 at the time of the dismantlement of the ussr <\s>
<s> the following decade saw mongolia endure both deep recession because of political inaction and natural disasters as well as economic growth because of reform-embracing free-market economics and extensive privatization of the formerly state-run economy <\s>
<s> severe winters and summer droughts in 2000-02 resulted in massive livestock die-off and zero or negative gdp growth <\s>
<s> this was compounded by falling prices for mongolia's primary sector exports and widespread opposition to privatization <\s>
<s> growth averaged nearly 9 per year in 2004-08 largely because of high copper prices and new gold production <\s>
<s> in 2008 mongolia experienced a soaring inflation rate with year-to-year inflation reaching nearly 30 the highest inflation rate in over a decade <\s>
<s> by late 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of the global financial crisis falling commodity prices helped lower inflation but also reduced government revenues and forced cuts in spending <\s>
<s> in early 2009 the international monetary fund reached a 236 million stand-by arrangement with mongolia and the country has started to move out of the crisis <\s>
<s> although the banking sector remains unstable the government is now enforcing stricter supervision regulations <\s>
<s> in october 2009 the government passed long-awaited legislation on an investment agreement to develop mongolia's oyu tolgoi mine considered to be one of the world's largest untapped copper deposits <\s>
<s> the economy grew an estimated 7 in 2010 largely on the strength of exports to nearby countries and international reserves reached 1.6 billion in september an all time high for mongolia <\s>
<s> mongolia's economy continues to be heavily influenced by its neighbors <\s>
<s> mongolia purchases 95 of its petroleum products and a substantial amount of electric power from russia leaving it vulnerable to price increases <\s>
<s> trade with china represents more than half of mongolia's total external trade china receives about two-thirds of mongolia's exports <\s>
<s> remittances from mongolians working abroad are sizable but have fallen due to the economic crisis money laundering is a growing concern <\s>
<s> mongolia joined the world trade organization in 1997 and seeks to expand its participation in regional economic and trade regimes <\s>
<s> montenegro montenegro severed its economy from federal control and from serbia during the milosevic era and maintained its own central bank adopted the deutchmark then the euro rather than the yugoslav dinar as official currency collected customs tariffs and managed its own budget <\s>
<s> the dissolution of the loose political union between serbia and montenegro in 2006 led to separate membership in several international financial institutions such as the european bank for reconstruction and development <\s>

<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>
<s> economic policies pursued since 2003 by king mohammed vi have brought macroeconomic stability to the country with generally low inflation improved financial performance and steady progress in developing the service and industrial sectors <\s>
<s> in 2006 morocco entered a free trade agreement fta with the us and in 2008 entered into an advanced status in its 2000 association agreement with the eu <\s>
<s> however poverty illiteracy and unemployment rates remain high <\s>
<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>
<s> morocco's trade and budget deficits widened in 2010 and reducing govenment spending and adapting to sluggish economic growth in europe will be challenges in 2011 <\s>
<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>
<s> mozambique at independence in 1975 mozambique was one of the world's poorest countries <\s>
<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>
<s> in 1987 the government embarked on a series of macroeconomic reforms designed to stabilize the economy <\s>
<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>
<s> fiscal reforms including the introduction of a value-added tax and reform of the customs service have improved the government's revenue collection abilities <\s>
<s> in spite of these gains mozambique remains dependent upon foreign assistance for more than half of its annual budget and the majority of the population remains below the poverty line <\s>
<s> subsistence agriculture continues to employ the vast majority of the country's work force and smallholder agricultural productivity and productivity growth is weak <\s>
<s> a substantial trade imbalance persists although the opening of the mozal aluminum smelter the country's largest foreign investment project to date has increased export earnings <\s>
<s> at the end of 2007 and after years of negotiations the government took over portugal's majority share of the cahora bassa hydroelectricity hcb company a dam that was not transferred to mozambique at independence because of the ensuing civil war and unpaid debts <\s>
<s> more power is needed for additional investment projects in titanium extraction and processing and garment manufacturing that could further close the import export gap <\s>
<s> mozambique's once substantial foreign debt has been reduced through forgiveness and rescheduling under the imf's heavily indebted poor countries hipc and enhanced hipc initiatives and is now at a manageable level <\s>
<s> in july 2007 the millennium challenge corporation mcc signed a compact with mozambique the compact entered into force in september 2008 and will continue for five years <\s>
<s> compact projects will focus on improving sanitation roads agriculture and the business regulation environment in an effort to spur economic growth in the four northern provinces of the country <\s>
<s> mozambique grew at an average annual rate of 9 in the decade up to 2007 one of africa's strongest performances <\s>
<s> however heavy reliance on aluminum which accounts for about one-third of exports subjects the economy to volatile international prices <\s>
<s> the sharp decline in aluminum prices during the global economic crisis lowered gdp growth by several percentage points <\s>
<s> despite 8.3 gdp growth in 2010 the increasing cost of living prompted citizens to riot in september 2010 after bread price increases were announced <\s>
<s> in an attempt to contain the cost of living the government implemented subsidies decreased taxes and tariffs and instituted other fiscal measures <\s>
<s> namibia the economy is heavily dependent on the extraction and processing of minerals for export <\s>
<s> mining accounts for 8 of gdp but provides more than 50 of foreign exchange earnings <\s>
<s> rich alluvial diamond deposits make namibia a primary source for gem-quality diamonds <\s>
<s> namibia is the fourth-largest exporter of nonfuel minerals in africa the world's fifth-largest producer of uranium and the producer of large quantities of lead zinc tin silver and tungsten <\s>
<s> the mining sector employs only about 3 of the population while about 35-40 of the population depends on subsistence agriculture for its livelihood <\s>
<s> namibia normally imports about 50 of its cereal requirements in drought years food shortages are a major problem in rural areas <\s>
<s> a high per capita gdp relative to the region hides one of the world's most unequal income distributions as shown by namibia's gini coefficient <\s>
<s> the namibian economy is closely linked to south africa with the namibian dollar pegged one-to-one to the south african rand <\s>
<s> until 2010 namibia drew 40 of its budget revenues from the southern african customs union sacu <\s>
<s> increased payments from sacu put namibia's budget into surplus in 2007 for the first time since independence <\s>
<s> sacu allotments to namibia increased in 2009 but will drop for 2010 and 2011 because south africa went into recession during the global economic crisis reducing overall sacu income <\s>
<s> increased fish production and mining of zinc copper uranium and silver spurred growth in 2003-08 but growth in recent years was undercut by poor fish catches higher costs of producing metals and the global recession <\s>
<s> nauru revenues of this tiny island have traditionally come from exports of phosphates now significantly depleted <\s>
<s> an australian company in 2005 entered into an agreement intended to exploit remaining supplies <\s>
<s> few other resources exist with most necessities being imported mainly from australia its former occupier and later major source of support <\s>
<s> the rehabilitation of mined land and the replacement of income from phosphates are serious long-term problems <\s>
<s> reserves of phosphates may only last until 2010 at current mining rates <\s>
<s> in anticipation of the exhaustion of nauru's phosphate deposits substantial amounts of phosphate income were invested in trust funds to help cushion the transition and provide for nauru's economic future <\s>
<s> as a result of heavy spending from the trust funds the government faces virtual bankruptcy <\s>
<s> to cut costs the government has frozen wages and reduced overstaffed public service departments <\s>
<s> nauru lost further revenue in 2008 with the closure of australia's refugee processing center making it almost totally dependent on food imports and foreign aid <\s>
<s> housing hospitals and other capital plant is deteriorating <\s>
<s> the cost to australia of keeping the government and economy afloat continues to climb <\s>
<s> few comprehensive statistics on the nauru economy exist with estimates of nauru's gdp varying widely <\s>
<s> navassa island subsistence fishing and commercial trawling occur within refuge waters <\s>
<s> nepal nepal is among the poorest and least developed countries in the world with almost one-quarter of its population living below the poverty line <\s>
<s> agriculture is the mainstay of the economy providing a livelihood for three-fourths of the population and accounting for about one-third of gdp <\s>
<s> industrial activity mainly involves the processing of agricultural products including pulses jute sugarcane tobacco and grain <\s>
<s> nepal has considerable scope for exploiting its potential in hydropower with an estimated 42,000 mw of feasible capacity but political instability hampers foreign investment <\s>
<s> additional challenges to nepal's growth include its landlocked geographic location civil strife and labor unrest and its susceptibility to natural disaster <\s>
<s> netherlands the netherlands economy is noted for stable industrial relations moderate unemployment and inflation a sizable current account surplus and an important role as a european transportation hub <\s>
<s> industrial activity is predominantly in food processing chemicals petroleum refining and electrical machinery <\s>
<s> a highly mechanized agricultural sector employs only 2 of the labor force but provides large surpluses for the food-processing industry and for exports <\s>
<s> the netherlands along with 11 of its eu partners began circulating the euro currency on 1 january 2002 <\s>
<s> the country has been one of the leading european nations for attracting foreign direct investment and is one of the four largest investors in the us <\s>
<s> after 26 years of uninterrupted economic growth the netherlands economy which is highly open and dependent on foreign trade and financial services was hard-hit by global economic crisis <\s>
<s> dutch gdp contracted 3.9 in 2009 while exports declined nearly 25 due to a sharp contraction in world demand <\s>
<s> the dutch financial sector has also suffered due in part to the high exposure of some dutch banks to u s <\s>
<s> the state retains monopolies in a number of sectors including tobacco the telephone network and the postal service <\s>
<s> living standards are high roughly comparable to those in prosperous french metropolitan areas <\s>
<s> mongolia economic activity in mongolia has traditionally been based on herding and agriculture mongolia's extensive mineral deposits however have attracted foreign investors <\s>
<s> the country holds copper gold coal molybdenum fluorspar uranium tin and tungsten deposits which account for a large part of foreign direct investment and government revenues <\s>
<s> soviet assistance at its height one-third of gdp disappeared almost overnight in 1990 and 1991 at the time of the dismantlement of the ussr <\s>
<s> the following decade saw mongolia endure both deep recession because of political inaction and natural disasters as well as economic growth because of reform-embracing free-market economics and extensive privatization of the formerly state-run economy <\s>
<s> severe winters and summer droughts in 2000-02 resulted in massive livestock die-off and zero or negative gdp growth <\s>
<s> this was compounded by falling prices for mongolia's primary sector exports and widespread opposition to privatization <\s>
<s> growth averaged nearly 9 per year in 2004-08 largely because of high copper prices and new gold production <\s>
<s> in 2008 mongolia experienced a soaring inflation rate with year-to-year inflation reaching nearly 30 the highest inflation rate in over a decade <\s>
<s> by late 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of the global financial crisis falling commodity prices helped lower inflation but also reduced government revenues and forced cuts in spending <\s>
<s> in early 2009 the international monetary fund reached a 236 million stand-by arrangement with mongolia and the country has started to move out of the crisis <\s>
<s> although the banking sector remains unstable the government is now enforcing stricter supervision regulations <\s>
<s> in october 2009 the government passed long-awaited legislation on an investment agreement to develop mongolia's oyu tolgoi mine considered to be one of the world's largest untapped copper deposits <\s>
<s> the economy grew an estimated 7 in 2010 largely on the strength of exports to nearby countries and international reserves reached 1.6 billion in september an all time high for mongolia <\s>
<s> mongolia's economy continues to be heavily influenced by its neighbors <\s>
<s> mongolia purchases 95 of its petroleum products and a substantial amount of electric power from russia leaving it vulnerable to price increases <\s>
<s> trade with china represents more than half of mongolia's total external trade china receives about two-thirds of mongolia's exports <\s>
<s> remittances from mongolians working abroad are sizable but have fallen due to the economic crisis money laundering is a growing concern <\s>
<s> mongolia joined the world trade organization in 1997 and seeks to expand its participation in regional economic and trade regimes <\s>
<s> montenegro montenegro severed its economy from federal control and from serbia during the milosevic era and maintained its own central bank adopted the deutchmark then the euro rather than the yugoslav dinar as official currency collected customs tariffs and managed its own budget <\s>
<s> the dissolution of the loose political union between serbia and montenegro in 2006 led to separate membership in several international financial institutions such as the european bank for reconstruction and development <\s>
<s> in january 2007 montenegro joined the world bank and imf <\s>
<s> montenegro is pursuing its own membership in the world trade organization and signed a stabilization and association agreement with the european union in october 2007 <\s>
<s> the european council granted candidate country status to montenegro at the december 2010 session <\s>
<s> unemployment and regional disparities in development are key political and economic problems <\s>
<s> montenegro has privatized its large aluminum complex the dominant industry as well as most of its financial sector and has begun to attract foreign direct investment in the tourism sector <\s>
<s> the global financial crisis has had a significant negative impact on the economy due to the ongoing credit crunch a decline in the real estate sector and a fall in aluminum exports <\s>
<s> montserrat severe volcanic activity which began in july 1995 has put a damper on this small open economy <\s>
<s> a catastrophic eruption in june 1997 closed the airports and seaports causing further economic and social dislocation <\s>
<s> two-thirds of the 12,000 inhabitants fled the island <\s>
<s> some began to return in 1998 but lack of housing limited the number <\s>
<s> the agriculture sector continued to be affected by the lack of suitable land for farming and the destruction of crops <\s>
<s> prospects for the economy depend largely on developments in relation to the volcanic activity and on public sector construction activity <\s>
<s> the uk has launched a three-year 122.8 million aid program to help reconstruct the economy <\s>
<s> half of the island is expected to remain uninhabitable for another decade <\s>
<s> morocco morocco's market economy benefits from the country's relatively low labor costs and proximity to europe which aid key areas of the economy such as agriculture light manufacturing tourism and remittances <\s>
<s> morocco is also the world's largest exporter of phosphate which has long provided a source of export earnings and economic stability <\s>

<s> in response to these challenges king mohammed in 2005 launched a national initiative for human development a 2 billion program aimed at alleviating poverty and underdevelopment by expanding electricity to rural areas and replacing urban slums with public and subsidized housing among other policies <\s>

<s> morocco's long-term challenges include improving education and job prospects for young moroccans closing the disparity in wealth between the rich and the poor confronting corruption and expanding and diversifying exports beyond phosphates and low-value-added products <\s>

<s> socialist mismanagement and a brutal civil war from 1977-92 exacerbated the situation <\s>

<s> these steps combined with donor assistance and with political stability since the multi-party elections in 1994 have led to dramatic improvements in the country's growth rate <\s>
